fields.description:
I couldn't find it anywhere, but it seems that you can't actually set a notification (in form of e-mail or just a notification in the Atlassian notification bar) to a project admin if the new customer account is registered.

My project is set that only project admins can invite new customers but I still would like to know if the invitation is still pending or if the user has registered (would be good in the _Customers_ section in the navigation side bar.
fields.summary: Notification when user account is registered

fields.description:
Currently voice notification and sms notification is available in Opsgenie essentials edition with a limit, however voice notification is not present in Jira Service Management's standard edition (even though sms limit is) but only in the premium edition. 

 

Since the Jira Service Management standard edition is meant to closely match the Opsgenie essentials edition. Suggestion is to provide voice notification to the Jira Service Management standard edition.
fields.summary: Voice notification in Jira Service Management standard edition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a queue, a custom field of *Select List (cascading)* type does not show any value, it just shows a value "*Any*".

We see the above behavior when the following conditions are met:
 * If the *Select List (cascading)* has multiple *contexts* for different projects.
 * And if there is *no* Global context set for this field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with *Select List (cascading)*
 # *Delete* the *default* context which has global scope.
 # Create multiple contexts for different projects (Make sure one of them is a Jira Service Management project to create a Queue).
 # Navigate to a Jira Service Management project and create a *Queue*, now when you are in *Basic search* click on *+More* and search for this custom field, and try to set a value.

h3. Expected Results

It should display all the values according to the *Context*.
 This works perfectly fine when we are building a JQL on the *Advanced Search* page, this issue is only when we are creating *Queue.*
h3. Actual Results

We just get an option *Any*:
 !image-2021-01-22-22-13-12-195.png! 
 If we switch to *JQL* then all the options which are configured for other projects are also displayed.
 If there is a *Context* set with *Global* visibility, then these values will be displayed without any issue when creating a *Queue*.
h3. Workaround

Navigate to the *Advanced Search* tab and build the necessary JQLquery for the Queue, and then use this query to create the Queue.
fields.summary: Not able to set Cascading field value in Basic search when creating a queue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Trying to change the issue type while creating a linked issue will result in the field "flashing" and the value returning to the original one.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a JSM ticket
 # Click on *Link issue* > *Create linked issue*.
 # On the "create linked issue" screen, change the issue type

h3. Expected Results

The issue type will be successfully changed.
h3. Actual Results

The issue type will be reverted to the original one.

GIF of the error: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/Z4u6eGWN]

The following error appears on the browser console:
{code:java}
"error": "The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors."
{code}
h3. Notes
 - The error doesn't seem to affect all JSM projects.
 - The error affects just a few users.

h3. Workaround

- Create a test issue (through the create button) using any issue type (*NOT request type*). Try creating a linked issue again, this should work.
-- Note You will need to re-apply this workaround every time you create an issue with a request type in the issue create dialog. This is due to Jira trying to pre-select an option that does not exist in the create linked issue dialog.
- Additionally, you can create the linked issue using the "wrong" issue type and then move it to the correct one. In this case, the bug will persist.

Workaround video: https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/402620/linked%20issue%20create%20work%20around.mp4
fields.summary: Unable to change the issue type while creating a linked issue

fields.description:
Currently, we only have the option to Exclude the user who has caused the action.

It would be beneficial to provide more flexibility and conditions to exclude a user who is causing the action. For example, exclude the user causing the action if they belong to a particular group/role.
fields.summary: Add more options to exclude users from receiving Customer notification

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

As we grow with more customers, we would like to understand how our customers use our content (portal, KB, how they raise tickets to us etc), similar to Google Analytic. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a feature to understand how JSM customers use the product (portal, KB etc)
fields.summary: Feature to understand how JSM customers use the product

fields.description:
Currently, it is only possible to hide a project from the portal via the Customer Permissions => Service Project Access setting.

 

It would be nice to have an option to hide or show a project based on Users / Groups / Customers.
fields.summary: Hide specifict Projects from certain users on Portal

fields.description: Currently, the Comments Permission only enables us to manage permissions for all types of comments (internal AND external). An option to manage this more granularly would be nice. I.e., the ability to restrict external comments to certain project roles / users / groups.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict external / internal comments via Permissions

fields.description:
The Assets API allows storing metadata on an asset object according to [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/assetsapi/rest/api-group-assets/#api-asset-put]

However, the same is not possible when storing asset types. Adding the fields attribute will allow the asset platform to be used as a more flexible data store for apps wishing to store additional metadata on the assets platform. Apps can fetch this data directly from the assets API for enhancing their user experience.
fields.summary: Add support for a fields attribute on asset types for storing additional metadata

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to search JSM customers (who are internal users with JSM access) part of organisation directly from the customer section of the project.

It is possible to search for the customer by directly navigating to the organisation
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate a customer to Atlassian account
 # Keep the user as trusted or provide only JSM access
 # Add the user as a customer to one of the organisation
 # Try searching for the customer directly from the customer section of the project.

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to search for the customer
h3. Actual Results
Unable to search for the customer.

h3. Workaround

Partial workaround is to navigate to the organisation from the customer section and searching  for the customer.
fields.summary: Unable to search JSM customers part of organization directly from the customer section of the project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
By default, for JSM Next gen project will not have a resolution value. Due to this, it impact certain feature as the in the classic project , issue will not consider as closed if resolution field not updated. In this case, it impact the REST API request for CSAT :-

{noformat}
POST /rest/servicedeskapi/request/{requestIdOrKey}/feedback
{noformat}

It failed with the error below :-

{noformat}
    "errorMessage": "The issue must be resolved before you can give feedback to it",
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create issue for Next gen project
 # Closed the issue
# Update CSAT using REST API

h3. Expected Results
Able to update it.

h3. Actual Results
It failed with the error below :-

{noformat}
    "errorMessage": "The issue must be resolved before you can give feedback to it",
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Update CSAT via email.
fields.summary: Updating CSAT via REST API for next gen project failed due to no resolution value updated

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Our company really loves your product, and we are looking for options to continue stay with you :). However, the main requirement for us and ours customers: Canadian data residency.

Does Atlassian Team has in roadmap to up and run Jira Software with Service Management (old name Service Desk) in Canadian Data Center?
fields.summary: Canadian Data Center for Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Service Management Free plan is not sending SMS notifications for OpsGenie alerts. 
 It is only observed for newly created JSM free accounts.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Sign up for JSM Free subscription. 
 # Launch Opsgenie, configure user profile to receive SMS for alerts.
 # Create a test alert that notified the user.

h3. Expected Results

The user must receive the SMS notification for an alert.
h3. Actual Results

The SMS notification is not received. The alert activity log shows- 
{noformat}
SmsStatus: You have exceeded your allowed limit for [sms] notifications. Please contact Opsgenie Customer Success team, if additional assistance is required.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: JSM Free plan is not sending SMS notifications for OpsGenie alerts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, when the administrator trying to set up a custom email request using the Microsoft 3LO OAuth feature, it will automatically set the already logged-in personal account to connect the email channel.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to JIRA using a Microsoft account
 # Open JSM project
# Go to *Project Settings > Email Request*
# Click the *Microsoft* option

h3. Expected Results
Able to update a different Microsoft account.

h3. Actual Results

Automatically set the already logged in account as the email request.

h3. Workaround

Log in to JIRA using a different non-SSO account at incognito browser. Then , go to Email request page to set up the Microsoft account as custom email.
fields.summary: Configure custom email using Microsoft 3LO OAuth automatically set the already logged-in personal account to connect an email channel

fields.description:
I'm using the widget in various context / apps, and I'm only managing one Service Desk project, and the widget may return results that is not relevant. 

It would be fantastic to be able to create multiple widget configuration inside one service desk project.

Another option would be to be able to filter the knowledge base articles return by the widget with extra wiki categories.
fields.summary: Service Project (next-gen) multiple widget configuration feature

fields.description:
h3. Description

If you have more than one rule that runs when the issue is created, when the event issue created is fired, then a race condition starts to run the automation rules. The automation rules are asynchronous, so we don't have how to determine in which order they will be run.

Therefore, if we have an automation rule that will delete the issue if the conditions don't match, the other rule will fail.
h3. Suggestion

It would be great if we have an automation condition to validate if the issue still exists.
fields.summary: Automation condition to validate if the issue still exists

fields.description:
h3. Current Behavior
Currently, the asset field returns no results when a single character or two characters are entered in the asset field. To get the filtered search results, a minimum of 3 characters need to be entered to start getting matching search results

This not be very helpful for situations where the customers might not be aware of all the asset names to link. 

h3. Expected Behavior
It will be a good idea to allow the filter search results to be returned even when a single character or two characters are entered in the asset field
fields.summary: Ability to search for assets with less than 3 characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Self sign up portal doesn't send invitation email when the account was deleted from site previously
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite an email address and make this as portal-only user > migrate it to Atlassian Account. (Or, any other Atlassian account without any Application access)
 ** This email address should now show up in customer section
 ** [https://URL.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/|https://url.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/]<pkey>/customers
 # Delete this account from User Management which will remove it from customer section above (/)
 # Perform self sign up from portal using the same email address
 ** [https://URL.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/|https://url.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/]<portal ID>/user/signup

h3. Expected Results
 * Invitation email should be sent out and the account should be shown under "Customer" section
 ** [https://URL.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/|https://url.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/]<pkey>/customers

h3. Actual Results

No invitation email sent and the account is Not shown under "Customer" section. This causes confusion to the Agent and users as no one knows why this specific account/email address can't be invited and no email received. 

h3. Notes

Deleted account is not shown in User Management page; making it impossible for user to know if the account was active and the deleted from the site in the past.

h3. Workaround
 * Invite the user via User Management without application access. This would allow this account to be shown under Customer section.
fields.summary: Self signup portal doesn't send invitation email when the account was deleted from site

fields.description: Human instinct looking at a clock it the time elapsed and not have to work out and subtract to see how long a response time has taken
fields.summary: response time Clock counting  should be count up not count down

fields.description:
Suggestion :

The customer would like to have the feature to have a resolution screen to pop-up while the ticket is moved to the DONE status.

So this way customers can directly send an email through the Resolution screen like we have in the company-managed (formerly classic) project.

Workaround :
Send the email through comment
fields.summary: Add a resolution screen to team-managed (formerly next-gen) project when ticket moves to DONE status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to make REST calls for fetching project information is failing with the error message will show *Error Message:* *"Project was not found"* 
{code:java}
https://tabassum26.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/RA/incomingemail
https://tabassum26.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/1/pages/agent/servicedesk/10221

{code}
{code:java}
{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"Project was not found"}],"reasonKey":"sd.admin.servicedesk.error.missingproject","reasonCode":"404"}
{code}
h3. Proposed Solution

Improve to provide appropriate error message for the REST API call by mentioning that REST API is failing due to permission issue for the user rather displaying error message Project not found.
h3. Expected Results

The error message should be appropriate.
|errorMessage|"You don't have permission to administer this service project"|
|reasonKey|"sd.jsm.admin.servicedesk.common.error.permissions"|
|reasonCode|"403"|
h3. !Screenshot 2021-01-21 at 2.38.06 PM.png|width=462,height=145!

Note: If the Agent does not have Service Desk Team role for Browse Project permission the above error message is displayed.

and it is resolved by Add the users from *Project Settings*->*People* section to the *Service Desk Team* role
h3.
fields.summary: Improve the error message when REST API calls fails.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, while configuring the KB in a JSM project, if there are more than 20 articles, the pagination shows up. However, it doesn't show the total number of pages in the knowledge base.
 !Screen Shot 2021-01-21 at 4.08.54 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the total number of pages available in the project
fields.summary: Knowledge base configuration should show the total number of pages in attached KB space

fields.description:
As an admin I need to configure Mail handlers to allow Jira notification replies to get added as comments on the existing tickets.
It only allows creating 'Mail Handler' for one project and issue type. We have hundreds of projects with multiple issue types. Going by this approach we will end up creating hundreds of mil handlers.
Instead, can you please help me create a master mail handler for multiple projects and issue types.
This is very critical for us.
fields.summary: As an admin I need to be able to use one email handler for all JSM projects and for several request types

fields.description:
We would like to be able to disable the Getting Started page and the Welcome Back screen in Jira for the entire organization.

The IT department from our customer receives many complaints or confused e-mails from their users about these pages as the users just expect to see the Jira interface that they are used to see.
fields.summary: Possibility to disable getting started and welcome back screen in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Description
While extracting a JSM weekly report the weeks are hard-coded to display reports starting as of Monday. 

h3. Suggestion
It would be nice to have the opportunity to define the day that your week starts such as Sunday, Monday...
fields.summary: Add the ability to define start of week for JSM reports

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* It would be beneficial if Jira Service Management(JSM) allowed admins to configure an email subscription for customers which reports/displays the customer's open requests
* This allows admins to easily prompt their customers to reply to open requests

h3. Suggested Solution
* Implement a solution similar to the solution available for Jira users: https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/work-with-search-results/ - the filter results are sent to a subscriber's email address, but in the context of a JSM customer
* The email message/body should be customizable so admins can modify the email content and layout to suit their needs

h3. Why this is important
* Reduce timeout situations where the customer may forget that they have a ticket open on the Service Desk
* Prompts customers to reply/respond to their requests
 
h3. Workaround 
* No viable workarounds
fields.summary: Ability for admins to configure scheduled reports of open requests that is sent to customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Collaborators are not able to view the assets that are already linked to a JSM issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and add some assets to the "linked assets" field. If you don't see the field, click "configure fields" in the top right. If you are on staging you might also have to install the connect app with the url: [https://sd-connect-testbed.dev.services.atlassian.com/atlassian-connect.json|https://sd-connect-testbed.dev.services.atlassian.com/atlassian-connect.json)]
 # Try to view the issue as a collaborator

 

Add a collaborator by:
 * going to settings > user management > users 
 * click on "show details" for the user you want > turn off their access to Jira Service Management
 * Go back to your project > project settings > people > Add people > type their email address > choose role as "Service Desk Team"
 * Note you can add yourself as another user by using [<yourusername>@usersinbuckets.com|mailto:jkirk@usersinbuckets.com]
 * You can log in to your Jira project under that name using an incognito window

h3. Expected Results

The collaborator should be able to view the assets that are liked to this issue
h3. Actual Results

The collaborator is not able to view the assets that are liked to this issue
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This is happening because the collaborators don't have edit permission for a JSM issue. However, viewing linked assets shouldn't require EDIT permission
h3. Workaround

For Insight cloud you can copy the Insight field to a custom field using: [configure the 'Set a Jira field with the attribute value from a selected object' post function|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSCLOUD/How+to+configure+the+%27Set+a+Jira+field+with+the+attribute+value+from+a+selected+object%27+post+function]
fields.summary: Collaborators are not able to view the assets that are already linked to a JSM issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Jira Service Management, when navigating to the [Queues of the project|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/what-are-queues/], under the *Assignee* part, there will have a field to be populated with a new assignee for the issue.

When tapping this field, the data will not be auto-populated until a character is inserted.

(i) When adding a character and then, deleting the text to keep it blank again, it will auto-populate as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Jira Service Management, make sure to create a project with at least, one issue.
# Go to the *Queues* option from the sidebar.
# Under the *Assignee* part, tap its corresponding field (I.E. Unassigned).

h3. Expected Results
The field should provide a list of users to be assigned.

h3. Actual Results
No user is suggested. Instead, a *No-options* suggestion is displayed:

!no_options.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
* Start typing to get a list of users matching the text.
* Start typing and remove the added text. This will auto-populate the field with suggestions, as expected.
fields.summary: Tapping the Assignee field will not auto-populate it if no character is added

fields.description:
When a Jira ticket is created by an Opsgenie alert through the outgoing way of the Jira integration in Opsgenie, only the issue key of the corresponding ticket is added in the extra properties field in that Opsgenie alert. 

It would be a nice feature to make that issue key a clickable link or create another extra property field to provide a link to that Jira ticket. Similarly, a link to the corresponding Opsgenie alert should be added in that Jira ticket right after the ticket creation.
fields.summary: Create a link to the Jira ticket in the Opsgenie alert

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using Heading 6 on an article is rendering as all caps on Jira view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an article;
 # Use Heading 6;
 # Publish;
 # On Wiki it will render as supposed to;
 # On Jira/Customer Portal it will render as all caps.

h3. Expected Results
Renders normally.

h3. Actual Results
It renders as all caps.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior other than not using the heading 6.
fields.summary: Heading 6 in articles renders as all caps on Jira/Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Current Scenario

Currently, it's not possible to add both an internal and external comment on the same update. The same text appears on both tabs, and the visibility will be defined by the selected tab when the comment is saved

 !image-2021-01-15-12-23-35-149.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Desired scenario

It would be great to have the ability to post an internal note alongside the external comment, by adding text to the "Internal" comment tab
fields.summary: Ability to add both internal and external comments on the same update

fields.description:
It would be really useful to be able to define an SLA based on when a ticket leaves a certain status in addition to entering a certain status. A simple case is where I want to set an SLA on when a ticket that is Escalated is moved to a different status. Right now, I need to specify start on "Enter: Escalated". Stop has to be defined on every possible status that could come after Escalated. If I add a new transition for Escalated in the future, I need to remember to update the SLA.

If I could define Stop as "Leave: Escalated", then I would start the clock on entry and stop the clock on Exit.
fields.summary: Add SLA triggers for Leave Status

fields.description:
Currently, invites are sent with a set expiration time.

This suggestion is to include an option to control that time, as customers can take weeks to get to their invitation and reach an invalid/expiry link.
fields.summary: Add ability to control expiry time for JSM customer invites

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Hyperlinks on the Request Type description take you to the Request Type form instead of taking you to the actual link

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a hyperlink to a request type's description text
 # Go to the request type list on the portal
 # Click the hyperlink on the request type description

h3. Expected Results
Be directed to the linked address

h3. Actual Results
You're sent to the form as if you've clicked the request type

* .gif demonstrating the behavior: https://share.getcloudapp.com/E0u41Gq5


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Hyperlinks on the Request Type description take you to the Request Type form instead of taking you to the actual link

fields.description:
*Update November 8 2021*
*Hello all,*

*We are currently in progress of consolidating the JSM incident object with the Opsgenie capabilities, which will allow any JSM incident to be marked as 'major'.*

*This will be a JQL-able property that can be utilised in Automation for Jira.*

*This should solve the ask of this ticket. We should start rolling this out in early December.*
*Stay tuned!*

*Dan*

*Associate Product Manager (Incident Management)*

*Jira Service Management*
----
 

Currently the process to trigger the creation of an incident in a JSM-connected Opsgenie account from JSM requires the manual escalation of a JSM incident to a 'major incident'. Some users would like the ability to use Jira automation rules to trigger this escalation instead, so that certain JSM issues can be configured to automatically escalate and trigger incidents in Opsgenie.

 

Currently, this sort of automation is only possible through the standard JSM alert integration in Opsgenie and a webhook in JSM, which technically allows for the automated creation of incidents in Opsgenie, but makes the syncing of teams/services difficult, and does not easily allow for bidirectional updates of the incident in both Jira and Opsgenie
fields.summary: Request for ability to automate 'Major Incident' escalation in JSM

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when a ticket created via REST API, Customer Portal or JIRA using the *Raise request on behalf* field to raise the issue on behalf of customer, the attachment added with the "Agent" account. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Set the attachment added by the reporter.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Set the Attachment added as the "Reporter" when issue created using "Raise request on behalf" feature

fields.description:
If there are more than 20 services configured in the Services Tab in an ITSM project.
The Affected Services Tab shows only the first 20 Services, it only displays the other options only when searched for. A User is expected to see all the services as a customer would be aware of all the services that are configured in a project.
fields.summary: Affected Service field in the Request form(Portal) should display all the services configured in a ITSM project

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

When the SLA impacting fields of the issue an issue is updated/changed, there should be an option to force recalculate the SLA based on the new issue fields.

*Suggested Solution*

An option to select _Recalculate SLA_ when SLA impacting fields of the issue are updated.

*Why this is important*

SLAs are critical for customers

*Workaround*
Force recalculate SLAs by following the below documentation
[SLAs in Jira Service Management are missing or disappear \- Jira \- Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/slas-in-jira-service-desk-are-missing-or-disapear-954252774.html]
fields.summary: Option to recalculate SLA when the SLA impacting fields of the issue is updated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to edit issue field layout form view issue screen eventhough the screen have "Request Type" value filled in. The *Configure* button can't be clicked and return the error below :-

{noformat}
You can't configure the layout of an issue while it doesn't have a request type
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open JSM issue
 # Make sure request type value filled in
# Scroll to the bottom and try to click *Configure*

h3. Expected Results
Able to configure the issue layout.

h3. Actual Results
Return the error below :-

{noformat}
You can't configure the layout of an issue while it doesn't have a request type
{noformat}
 !Screen Shot 2021-01-13 at 1.33.21 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to edit issue field layout from View issue screen

fields.description:
Currently, the "What's this?" text on the Description fields section of request types states that “Only multi-line text fields can be added here.”.

That is not true, however, and currently any field can be added to that section:

 !image-2021-01-11-14-21-29-352.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-01-11-14-21-43-163.png|thumbnail! 

Either the section should have its limits enforced by not allowing other fields, or the "What's this?" should be updated.
fields.summary: Enforce field limit or update help text on "Description fields" for Request Types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to add translation for fields pending translation, if any of the section has many fields, the  "Section needs review" covers the fields pending translation which are at the bottom of the page and hence, do not allow user to add these translation
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a lot of components in your project
 # Add a new language under "Language Support" and try to add translation for components pending review

h3. Expected Results

You will be able to "Confirm translation" for the fields pending translation
h3. Actual Results

Fields at the bottom of the page will not be displayed and will be covered by the prompt for "section needs review".

!image-2021-01-11-21-14-00-920.png|width=398,height=213!
h3. Workaround

You can add translation for these fields by opening a browser console via "Inspect" and then closing the window will make the fields visible
[^Screen Recording 2021-01-11 at 08.42 PM.mov]
fields.summary: "Section needs review" prompt in language support covers the fields pending translation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While editing an Automation Rule *Restrict who can move a request* in a Next-Gen project, the *The request’s assignee* and *The request’s reporter* are not visible. Only the concrete users are visible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request in a Next-Gen Service project.
# Go to Service project settings -- Request types.
# Select one of the Request types and click Edit workflow.
# Select one of the transitions and add an Automation Rule *Restrict who can move a request*.
# Select the people *The request’s assignee*, *The request’s reporter* and a user in the *Only allow these people to move requests using this transition* text box.
# Edit the same rule.

h3. Expected Results
*The request’s assignee*, *The request’s reporter*, and the selected user should be visible. 

h3. Actual Results
Only the selected user is visible.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not all users are visible while editing an Automation Rule 'Restrict who can move a request' in a Next-Gen project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issues without request type not respecting fields config in View Issue screen in new issue view.

Due to the lack of request type, there's no issue layout hence some fields are still showing up. Affected fields:
* Remaining time (Time tracking)
* Original estimate (Time tracking)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In View Issue screen, remove *Time tracking* fields.
 # Create an issue in the JSM project using the screen above.
# Observe the field in the new issue view mode.

h3. Expected Results

Without the request type, Time Tracking field's visibility should be based on screen configuration

h3. Actual Results

Time tracking fields are being shown regardless of a screen configuration.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issues without request type not respecting fields config in View Issue screen

fields.description:
Our previous systems allowed for our clients to favorite articles and filter by them, giving them a quick set of articles that they can get to quickly. 

This is also a feature that is available internally for confluence users in a myriad of ways (star and watching), it would be awesome we could provide our clients these features in the Service Desk Portal.
fields.summary: Ability for Jira Service Desk Portal users to favorite articles and filter by them

fields.description:
Currently, we have the ability to sort the categories and have them reflect on the portal page. 

The problem now is that the articles themselves, within each category cannot be sorted. They do not follow any discernable sort order and seem move up or down based on date last updated. 

It is important for us to be able to sort our articles *within* the categories, not just the categories themselves.
fields.summary: Ability to Reorder/sort the articles in Service Desk Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When adding a single page to a category, the customer will have to click on the category and then, click on the article in order to view it.
h3. Suggestion

If there is a single page in a category, once the customer clicks on it, open the article directly.
fields.summary: Open the article directly when only one page is added to a category

fields.description:
Ability to restrict agents from editing customer comments in the Project. 

Expected Results:

!Screenshot 2021-01-08 at 7.07.46 PM.png|width=481,height=252!
fields.summary: Ability to restrict agents from editing customer comments.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the current design, only the JSM tickets raised by Request Types under the “Incidents“ category will be able to show on the drop-down to link to the Opsgenie Incident and Alert, which is in line with [this documentation|https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/jira-service-desk-cloud#request-linking].

!image-2021-01-08-13-16-59-330.png|width=346,height=50!

It would be more flexible if we can link the JSM tickets from other request types.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create tickets from different request types on JSM.
 # Create an Opsgenie Alert and Incident, expand the field "Jira Service Management requests" to see what are the JSM tickets available for linking. 

h3. Expected Results

All kinds of tickets should be available for linking to Opsgenie Alert and Incident.
h3. Actual Results

Only the JSM tickets under "Incident" request types are available for linking.

  !image-2021-01-08-13-17-23-585.png|width=449,height=220!!image-2021-01-08-13-17-54-253.png|width=275,height=240!
fields.summary: Ability for linking JSM tickets from other request types to Opsgenie Incidents/Alerts

fields.description:
On the Customer portal it is possible to share a request with a person just based on an email address. 

However on the issue view (agent side) the Request Participants field only allows the selection of already existing customers.

It would be a great extension to also allow an Agent to add a Request Participant solely based on an email address (share with..)
fields.summary: Ability to add a request participant only by email without creating a customer first

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Removing a knowledge base article from a knowledgebase category doesn't work as expected. After deletion, it reappears again automatically.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Head to the knowledge base categories page.
# There will be a dynamic table and when you hover over any row you would see the 3-dots menu appear at the extreme right. Click on that.
# A dropdown menu appears which has options to edit the article in confluence or Remove the article. 
# Click on the *Remove* option.
# You will see that the article disappears from the table and then gets added back without doing anything.

When you refresh the page you would see that the article is no longer on the list. This issue exists on Article View and All Articles screen as well.

h3. Expected Results
The knowledge base article from a knowledgebase category is removed successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The knowledge base article from a knowledgebase category is not removed successfully.

h3. Workaround

When you refresh the page you would see that the article is no longer on the list. 

_Note:_ This issue exists on Article View and All Articles screen as well.
fields.summary: Removing a knowledge base article from a knowledgebase category doesn't work as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A required asset custom field on the customer portal does not report an error that the field is required

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Asset type custom field and add it to a request type on the customer portal
 # Integrate the asset field to a CMDB, (Insight for example)
 # Make the field required in Field configuration as well as on the customer portal
 # Make Summary field necessary too
 # Try to submit the request without the Summary field 
 # Fill the Summary field and try to submit the request without filling the asset field


h3. Expected Results
When you don't fill Summary or the Asset custom field, the following error is reported in the customer portal:
{quote}
please provide a value for the required field 'field name'
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
You receive an error for the Summary that it is required. 
However, this error message is not reported for the Asset custom field. Also, it does not allow the customer to submit the form. This makes it confusing for the customer to understand why the request cannot be submitted
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: A required asset custom field on the customer portal does not report an error that the field is required

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Date settings are not respected in next-gen project. It is always displayed as yyyy/MM/dd.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa and change the followings:
** jira.date.time.picker.java.format
** jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format
# Navigate to a next-gen project request and look at the custom date field

h3. Expected Results
The configured date and time setting is applied 
h3. Actual Results
The setting is not applied

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Date format settings are not respected in next-gen

fields.description:
Please add Arabic to the language options for Jira Service Management

https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PA-97208
fields.summary: Arabic language for Jira Service Management

fields.description:
Would be helpful to offer the option for alignment formatting as customers have requested this feature

https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PA-97208
fields.summary: Arabic Alignment in Jira Service Management Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There is a limitation with the *Impacted services* field where it displays only the first 10 Services if there are more than 10 Services configured.
The other services are displayed only if we manually search for that service. More details can be found here [JSDCLOUD-9589|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-9589].

While creating a Major incident, if we manually search and choose a Service that is not already present in the Dropdown(not one of the first 10 entries), the value is getting cleared.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an ITSM project
# Create more than 10 Services under the *Services* Tab
#  Now create an Incident ticket.
# Click on *Create major incident* on a ticket
# In the pop-up search for a service that is not already listed in the dropdown and select that service

h3. Expected Results
The value does not clear as stays as it is.

h3. Actual Results
The value is getting cleared.
 [^Screen Recording 2021-01-07 at 4.00.57 PM.mov] 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not able to select the Impacted Services while creating a Major Incident.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there are more than 20 services configured in the *Services* Tab in an ITSM project.
The Affected Services Tab shows only the first 20 Services, it only displays the other options only when searched for.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an ITSM Project
 # Go to the Services Tab and Create more than 20 Services.
 !image-2021-01-07-13-48-57-883.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create an Incident from the portal where the Request form contains the *Affected Service* field.
 # Click on *Affected Service* Dropdown

h3. Expected Results
This should display all the Affected Services configured.

h3. Actual Results
It displays only the first 20 Services
 !image-2021-01-07-13-49-42-743.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Affected Service field displays only the first 20 services in a ITSM project customer portal

fields.description:
The option to restrict comments to certain groups/roles in the new issue Detail View isn't available for the JSM projects.

It was possible for certain users in the old issue view to restrict the comments to certain groups/roles for JSM projects, this feature isn't available currently for the new issue view.
fields.summary: Unable to restrict comment in new UI of Issue Detail View for JSM projects

fields.description: For a lot of customers who feel "forced" into Cloud Service Management, and the new issue view, Atlassian should "eat their own dog food" and use Cloud for everything. This will help Atlassian be more in touch with some of their frustrated customers.
fields.summary: Atlassian should use Cloud Service Management (and the new issue view)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The JSM REST API allows the user to create a request, mixing *seviceDeskId* and *requestTypeId* that do not match. Additionally, the setting from the original *requestTypeId* may get reset on the process.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create two JSM projects: *Project Alpha* and *Project Beta* 
# Create one request type in each project. Make sure that they use the same Issue Type. Ex: *IT Help*
# Create a butch of custom fields.
# Add the custom fields to the issue type screen on *Project Alpha*.
# Add the custom fields to the request type screen on *Project Alpha*.
# Your settings should look similar to  
| | Project Alpha | Project Beta | 
| Service Desk Id | 1 | 10 | 
| Request Type Id | 2 | 20 | 
# Using the JSM Rest API, create a request with the following payload. : {noformat}
{
    "requestFieldValues": {
        "description": "description ",
        "summary": "Summary"
    },
    "requestTypeId": "20",
    "serviceDeskId": "1"
}{noformat}
(!) The call should have the *serviceDeskId* of Project Alpha, but the *requestTypeId* of Project Beta.

h3. Expected Results

The API request will fail with the message: "requestTypeId of 20 is not valid for serviceDeskId 1".

h3. Actual Results

# The request will be created on the Beta Project with a "No Match" Request Type.
# The fields on the *Project Alpha* Request Type will be reset, remaining only the fields that exist on the *Project Beta's* issue type screen.

h3.Workaround

The only workaround is to make sure that the fields exist on the *Issue Type*  screen on both projects. However, this doesn't prevent #1, which is the request being created with an invalid request type.
fields.summary: The JSM REST API allows the request creation with RequestIds not associated with the ServiceDeskId

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an user with Atlassian Account on the same domain as the Agent creates an issue on a JSM project customers notifications will inconsistenly use the Agent's Full Name and Public Name setup at https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have two Atlassian Accounts on the same domain, one as a customer and the other as an Agent on a JSM project;
# Change public name on the agent's Atlassian profile to be different from full name;
# Work on an issue to generate test notifications for a status transition other than resolving. Observe how the name in the from address on that issue is your full name, not your newly altered public name.
# Resolve an issue and observe how the name that appears in the from address in the resolved notification is your public name instead of your full name.

h3. Expected Results

The all notifications should use the Public Name as the "From" name

h3. Actual Results

Only notifications that inlcude the resolved notification use the Public name. Transitions and comment notifications will use the Full Name.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior for Customer Notification "From" name with Agent's Public vs. Full Name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Turning custom customer notifications on/off by clicking on the switch on the Customer Notifications page doesn't save the action.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Project settings* > *Customer notifications* > click on *Create a custom notification* (in case there is none) and proceed with the creation
 # Click on the 'Enable' switch
 # Leave the Customer notifications page and then return (or just refresh the page)

h3. Expected Results

The custom customer notification will be enabled/disabled according to the action you've just performed.
h3. Actual Results

The action won't take effect.
h3. Workaround

Click on *Edit* next to the notification > click on the cog icon > click on the 'Rule enabled' switch and *Save*.
fields.summary: Enabling/disabling custom customer notifications reverts the action after leaving the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Reports with large data sets or complex JQL fail to load and timeout.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a report with complex JQL query, or large amount of issues, such that the report has performance problems and takes a long time to load.
 # View the report's drill down.

h3. Expected Results

Report drilldown loads successfully
h3. Actual Results

Report times out which shouldn't be the case as the results are paginated.
h3. Workaround

Simplifying the JQL to include smaller data sets should improve the load time and avoid time outs.
fields.summary: Reports drilldown times out on large reports

fields.description:
I would like to put in a feature request for consideration. We use Jira Service Desk for all incoming requests across Digital, Marketing and IT services. We find for Digital/Marketing related requests there is a lot of back and forth with the user required which we ideally would like to keep within Jira and not revert to email. This is difficult to do when the functionality for the end user/requestor/portal user is so limited. This is also making it hard for us to continue to get buy in with the organisation so they can trust once they've logged their request they can also continue to work on it with the teams, provide feedback, review versions etc..

We obviously don't want to give all staff access to Service Desk licenses either, which would solve a lot of our issues, but we would like more functionality to be considered for the end user portal area / requestors.

Some issues/ideas are: 
 # End user facing KANBAN board - It would be ideal if we could have an end user facing KANBAN board of selected issues/types. This would provide the organisation visibility of the volume of requests in a queue at a given time, and to see in a KANBAN style where their ticket is in relation to others. Users could interact with this board in more ways than they can currently with the End User Portal way of checking the status of a request. 
 # Ability for requestors to @ people from the customer portal -  When checking the status of their request and adding more content, only the assignee of the ticket is notified. Being able to @ someone would allow for better communication.
 # Allow end users to see sub tasks or linked issues in the customer portal - End users cannot see sub-tasks or how Linked Issues are set up in relation to their main request. For example, we will receive a main request where we keep all the core info required to deliver. We'd ideally use sub-tasks to coordinate related tasks but cannot because the end user can't see those, only SD users can. So we use Linked Issues but this just creates a wall of new tickets for the end user in the customer portal, where us SD users can see that they are all linked together making it a useful feature. A better way to display/categorise Issues and Linked Issues in the customer portal would be amazing. 
 # Consider a different user type for Jira SD such as 'collaborator' -  Ideally we would allow some core end users to have full Jira functionality but we don't because we can't have them accessing other tickets not related to theirs, or seeing internal comments. Perhaps another user type could be created that allows an end user only to have full Jira SD access to a single Issue or request type. We could perhaps select a status for a ticket such as "In collaboration" which then allows it to be visible in full by the end user for that period or a user could be a 'collaborator' which provides them more visibility of their request but no access to other areas of Jira.

 

These are just some initial observations!
fields.summary: Feature request : Better functionality for customers (portal users)

fields.description: As a user, I would like the ability to separate Opsgenie from my existing Jira Service Management subscription into a standalone Opsgenie subscription.
fields.summary: Ability to separate Opsgenie into a standalone product from a Jira Service Management subscription

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a holiday to an SLA calendar, the *JQL from SLA Goal* option is reset in reports using that SLA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a report with a series based on an SLA (e.g., *Time to resolution - % Met*)
 # Set *JQL from SLA Goal* to a different option
 # Add a holiday to that calendar
 # View the *Series* and note that the calendar option is no longer selected and the first option is now selected

h3. Expected Results
The *Series* doesn't reset the selected *JQL from SLA Goal* option.

h3. Actual Results
The *Series* resets to the first option under *JQL from SLA Goal*

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When adding a holiday to an SLA calendar, the JQL from SLA Goal option is reset in reports using that SLA

fields.description: Please provide SD portal Lithuanian language support.
fields.summary: Lithuanian langage support for SD Cloud

fields.description:
We would like to have the ability to Start/Stop/Pause an SLA based on the transition.

For example, this can be useful in scenarios where we have several transitions to a status but we only want to pause the SLA when the issue goes thorough a specific transition(s).
fields.summary: Add condition in SLA based on "Transition" name

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to insert images or tables to the *Send email* command when selecting *HTML* as message type would be to convert the message to the HTML content and then share it in the body of the email.

It would be helpful if the ability to copy-paste images/tables is present in the *Send email* command in Jira
fields.summary: Ability to copy paste images and tables as attachment in the Send Email command

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A JSM mail handler (custom or default) that never processed an email returns the following error when clicking on "View logs":

"Something's gone wrong

Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support

ERROR: 6DUHRS"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new JSM project
 # Go to the default mail handler at *Project settings* > *Email requests*
 # Click on *View logs*

 - The issue will also occur on Next-gen.
 - It occurs if you add a custom mail handler as well.

h3. Expected Results

Logs are displayed, even if there are no emails processed.
h3. Actual Results

 !Screen Shot 2020-12-31 at 16.43.04.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

Send one email to the mail handler, in case the message is processed the issue doesn't occur anymore.
fields.summary: Empty JSM mail handler returns "Something's gone wrong" error when clicking on "View logs"

fields.description:
On Classic Service Management projects, it's possible to add request types into groups, so customers can easily find what they need.

When creating groups, we can add a name but, the description of the group will be the request types that it contains.

It would be great if, instead of showing the request types' names, administrators could add a custom description of what requests customers can find on that group.
fields.summary: Ability to change the description for "Portal Groups"

fields.description:
The customer would like to edit the 

"Could you (Atlassian) update Manage data residency documentation? Change wherever it is written "Jira Software" to just "Jira"? Or better to "Jira (all types)"?"

Document that need to be changed
https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-data-residency-976763149.html

The reason being this customer supports banking client and they want to show them that as of now, the JSM data is stored in the same location as Jira core . It is applicable to both Jira Core and JSM
fields.summary: Jira Service Management  data residency

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
[Extension for Jira Service Management|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212161/extension-for-jira-service-desk?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] App is not updating the Jira field's value

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Under a JSM project settings, configure your fields under *Customer Form Extension*
# Open the form at the customer portal and create a request

h3. Expected Results
The ticket is created with all the details filled in at the portal.

h3. Actual Results
The data is available at the customer portal, but if we check the ticket within the Jira interface the values are empty. The data at the customer portal is the one that resides on the app side, but in Jira, there aren't any updates on the values.

h3. Workaround
Use native [Request types|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/categorize-customer-requests-into-request-types/] instead.
fields.summary: Extension for Jira Service Management App is not updating Jira field's value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Inconsistent asset search in Insight

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few assets with a similar name. Such as a bunch of users..
# Try to search for them while creating a ticket using a different number of characters such as:
{noformat}
Us..
User..
Users..
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
The results should be consistent

h3. Actual Results
The above searches are not returning the exact same results.
 
h3. Workaround
Type the full asset name
fields.summary: Inconsistent asset search in Insight

fields.description:
h4. Problem Statement

The customer is facing inconvenience as the users on the site are using the *Create* button on the top instead of the *Raise a request* button in the sidebar. As a result of this, the creation process is not going through the project request type process on the portal. Because of this, the ticket is not correctly configured to be shown on the portal of that project (to the customer).
h4. Suggested Resolution

The option for the site admin to show or hide the Create button on top.
fields.summary: Ability to Show/Hide the Create button on top

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The customer cannot specify the email address as an approver if the account doesn't exist on the site:

{quote}
A selected user for this field no longer exists. Choose another user.
{quote}

 !Screen Shot 2020-12-28 at 17.46.36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option for admins that allows customers to add an approver as a new customer account.

h3. Workaround

This is counterintuitive; however, the following configuration allows the customers to create a new customer account with the approver's email address:

# open the *project settings*, and
# go to *Customer permissions* > *Service project access*, and
# choose "Anyone on the web (without logging in)"

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Option to add an approver as a new customer account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A feature to configure field in read only

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
Create a custom field in read only once the values are added there should not be a possibility to edit it.
 # Step 2
But it should show up in the view screen

h3. Expected Results
The files can be edited in the new issue view
h3. Actual Results
Restrict the field from editing in the view screen


h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: A feature to configure field in read only

fields.description:
From within the knowledge base, a recommendation engine offers the customer a suggestion of a similar article from within the space(s) linked to the Service Management Project.

MVP - Other documents based on labels are suggested.

Better - Confluence is scanning the content and finding similar documents.

Even Better - Based on other customers behaviours - "People who read this document also read these" - Think Netflix recommendation engine. "You liked watching Die Hard others who liked this watched [list of equally brilliant movies]"

Alternate thought - The recommendation could show tickets that have had this confluence page attached and are now solved/closed. Example document "How to resolve XYZ Error message" shows the last 10 ticket titles that have been solved.

_Odd popup message XYZ_

_Crash XYZ_

_System broken with XYZ message_
fields.summary: Recommendation engine for relevant documents/articles

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Accessing "Portal Groups" via the link on the Request Types list indefinitely spins

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access *Project Settings > Request Types*
 # Click the "portal groups" link above the list

h3. Expected Results
Be directed to https://instance.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/PKEY/settings/portal-settings/portal-groups

h3. Actual Results
You're directed to https://instance.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/PKEY/portal-settings/portal-groups which indefinitely spins/loads

*Note* copying and pasting the above link on a new tab will lead you to the Portal Settings page. .gif demonstrating the behavior: https://share.getcloudapp.com/p9urL8On


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessing "Portal Groups" via the link on the Request Types list indefinitely spins

fields.description:
At the moment the Portal / Knowledge base is not as "customer/user" friendly as the portal my users have in Zendesk. One user story is the ease of getting to the forms. We have 800 articles in our current knowledge base that are homed under Categories, Sections Sub Sections etc.

+User story+

_As a customer when I land on the Knowledge Base / Portal I want to be able to immediately raise a request without having to scroll to the bottom of the list of categories or articles to get to the issue forms._

 

+My recommendation+ 

Top right "Raise a request", which presents the Service Projects (IT, Finance, whatever is set up) or have the Need to raise a request? Contact us. Box moved to the top of the Categories listing.
fields.summary: Re-arrange Portal/Knowledge Base Need to raise a request to top

fields.description:
Hi,

The new feature for Request categories adds entry points for Incidents, Service Requests, Change and Problem.

As many teams only works for example with Incidents and Service Requests, it would be good to be able to hide/show the other categories. 

Even better would be to be able to edit their names. And even add more categories as all teams work in different ways. Many teams don't use the strict definition of ITIL types.
fields.summary: Make it possible to hide/create request type categories like Problems
Change Background Color for customer service desk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While editing the request form , user unable to add custom field to the request form. Once added , the field automatically removed from the form.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the project
 # Go to *Project Settings > Request Type*
# Edit any request type and go to *Request Form*
# Add a new custom field 
# Then go to a "Agent View" and go back to *Request Form*

h3. Expected Results
The field remains.

h3. Actual Results
Newly added field being removed.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to add custom field to "Request Form". Once add , it automatically been removed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In JSM project , when creating automation to Create issue or edit issue , the *Affected Services* field can't be updated. Due to that , the action failed with *java.lang.NullPointerException* error :-
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-22 at 1.42.20 pm.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the project
 # Go to *Project Settings > Automation > Automation*
# Configure as below :-
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-22 at 1.43.59 pm.png|thumbnail! 
# Update *Affected Services* field

h3. Expected Results
Able to update the value and choose the selection :-
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-22 at 1.44.45 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Not able to update 
h3. Workaround
No workaround. Only need to remove the field from the configuration.
fields.summary: Unable to update "Affected Services" value in Automation configuration for "Create Issue" action

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to view JSM incoming email audit logs, an error will be shown if the logs are empty.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new project
 # Navigate to project settings -> email requests
 # Click "view logs" 

h3. Expected Results
An empty table of email audit logs is shown

h3. Actual Results
An error flag is shown "Something's gone wrong"
!Screen Shot 2020-12-22 at 10.22.29 am.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the console file:
  !2020-12-22 at 09.41.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Send an email to the channel. 
Once it has been received and processed, the above error will not appear anymore.
fields.summary: Viewing incoming email audit logs show an error when the audit log is empty

fields.description:
Since the implementation of JSDCLOUD-170, it's possible to link multiple Confluence spaces with one JSM project. The KB settings allow you to control the Viewing permissions, choosing between 'Private' or 'Public' for each individual space.

The problem is that the articles of the spaces set as Public will be visible to all customers, so if a project is used to support customers from different companies, for example, customers will be able to see content from other companies.
h3. Suggestion

Implement the option to grant the Viewing permission for each linked space to specific customer organizations, so customers can't see content they're not supposed to.
fields.summary: Ability to associate KB spaces with customer organizations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have two goals, one without a defined Time Goal ("All remaining issues") and one with a "Issues to display (in JQL)" like, "status in ("In Progress", Acknowledged)" or "status - In Progress" and a start event of "Entered Status: In Progress", the SLA will disappear when the cycle is finished. The SLA will only display while the cycle is running.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create an SLA with "All remaining issues" with *No target*
* Add a goal, with Time Goal (Example: 5m) and that "Issues to display (in JQL)" has status in ("In Progress", "Y") 
** the issue will also occur if the  "Issues to display (in JQL)" has status = "In Progress"
* Add a "Start counting time when..." as "Entered Status: In Progress"
* Define a "Finish counting time when..."
* Create an issue that meets the criteria and close the SLA

Image illustrating:

 !Screen Shot 2020-12-21 at 12.07.31.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The SLA is displayed as closed when the cycle is finished.

h3. Actual Results

The SLA disappears when the cycle is finished. Even recalculating the SLA it's not displayed.


h3. Workaround

Add a goal time for "All remaining issues" on your SLA configuration and recalculate the SLA (https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-or-corrupted-sla-data-in-jira-service-management-828790603.html)
fields.summary: SLA disappears if there's no goal for the "All remaining issues" and issue "Start counting time when..." has "Entered Status: X" with the same status from what's filtered in another goal

fields.description:
Reflect the field configuration the same way as in the CFT.
As of now all request fields that are fetched from AWS are marked as required on the customer portal, this prevents submitting empty fields form in the JSM. 
The Workaround was to either configure default values for optional fields or use a separate template for resources with required parameters.

But customer says in all cases they can't say that they need a default value, there might
be a case where they don't need to give any input.
So based on this, their requirement is to reflect the field as it is from CFT.
fields.summary: Make input values at the customer portal the same way as in the CFT

fields.description:
Problem Definition:

The customer would like to use the *Department* attributes saved in the Managers account as a *search template* for the custom field Manager.

For example, if you see the below screenshot there is no possibility to change the search template to the department:
 !Screenshot 2020-12-18 at 5.39.54 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Suggested Solution:
Create a group to add all managers and type the manager's name while raising a request.

Workaround:
NA
fields.summary: Map department attribute instead of group picker in a custom field search template.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Customer account is not created if we grant *Add comments* permission to "Service Desk Customers Role"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your Global Jira Service Management configuration to allow customers to create their own account:
## Yes, by signing up or sending a request
# Access a JSM project and make sure that customer permissions are set as *Anyone on the web*
# Add the role "Service Desk customer" to the permission scheme to *Add comments*.
# Send an email from an account that still does not exist on your site.

h3. Expected Results
* Email should be processed just fine as the project is set as open.

h3. Actual Results
The ticket is not created and see the following error on JSM mail handler logs:
{noformat}
Signup is not currently available	
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround
Remove the "Add comment" permission for the customer role.
fields.summary: Customer account is not created if we grant "Add comments" permission to "Service Desk Customers Role"

fields.description:
The following instructions are included on the top of the 'Configure Screen' page:
{quote}You can configure the order of fields and tabs in a project by going to *Project settings* > *Issue layout*.
{quote}
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-15 at 15.31.08.png|thumbnail! 

Those steps only apply to Jira Software and Jira Core projects, as Jira Service Management doesn't have 'Issue Layout' in the project settings.

Please include on the 'Configure Screen' page the specific instructions to perform the same action in JSM projects: *Project settings* > *Request Types* > click on a Request Type > select the *Agent view* tab.
fields.summary: Include field order configuration instructions for JSM projects on the 'Configure Screen' page
Include Impacted Service Name in the Payload sent from a Webhook event to Opsgenie

fields.description:
When we click on Create Major Incident from an Incident ticket in the Jira Service Management project, the *Impacted Services* shows only the first 10 services.
 It only displays the Services when we search with the right Alphabets this makes it difficult for users who do not have all the Impacted Services memorized.

Screenshot of the *Create a Major incident* screen displaying only 10 Services:
!image-2020-12-14-21-44-53-574.png|thumbnail!

I had 11 Services configured in the above project.
fields.summary: Create a Major Incident from JSM displays only 10 Services

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

From time to time, some SLAs in some issues are not shown due to a few factors. There is no way to find out all the affected issues and a simple way to fix it. The only way is to follow below KB:
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/slas-in-jira-service-management-are-missing-or-disappear-954252774.html]

h3. Suggested Resolution

While it's possible to manually fix it, it would be great if there was a tool similar like "[Integrity checker in Jira Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/using-the-database-integrity-checker-938847667.html]" that would find all affected issues and reconstruct the SLA.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to recalculate or reconstruct SLA

fields.description:
As a site-admin I want to receive clearer messages when I attempt to create a project for a subscription that I don't have a license.

Current message is generic.
fields.summary: Clearer error messages - when creating a project without licence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a next-gen project, when a linked issue is created from an existing issue with approval, the approver field value would be copied from the original issue despite the workflow settings has "Agent selects approver"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an approval step to a workflow and select the option "Agent selects approver"
 # Make sure the approval field is the same field used by the linked issue.
 # Create a linked issue from an existing issue which has an approver

h3. Expected Results
The agent would be selecting the approver as configured
h3. Actual Results
The approver value is copied from the linked issue

h3. Workaround
Create a different approver field from the linked issue. If they are the same Request Types, the approval needs to be updated manually.
fields.summary: Creating a linked issue with approvals copies the approver value from linked issue

fields.description: For user (ie internal users) accessing Knowledge Base articles, it'd be useful to have a "See full Page" that links to the Confluence view of that Page/article, so that they could also easily browse related Pages.
fields.summary: Add a "See full article" link on KB articles for users with access that also have access to the Confluence Space

fields.description:
As an admin I want to be able to share the org member list with the customer who is the manager of such org. 

I want to give visibility of the org member list to the managers of the orgs that are my customers.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to be able to share a customer organisation member list with the customer.

fields.description:
As an agent, when I'm qualifying a ticket in Jira in the service desk, adding labels is a nightmare.

We have tens of labels, and I to find and select it in the labels searchbar, I'm forced to type the first letter, then the second, etc. to find it.

Ex: to find the label "Spend:Card:SinglePurchase", I would like to type "Card", and get the list of all tags having the word "Card" in it.
But this won't work, I'll have to type "Spend:Car..." etc. to see it appear in the dropdown.

I don't know all my labels by heart so it's not very convenient.
fields.summary: Searchbar for labels to be improved

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Changing the default email account on a newly enabled email request prompts an error "Cannot read property 'errorMessage' or undefined"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable email request on a project (disable and enable if you already have it enabled before)
 # Update the default email account

h3. Expected Results
Default email account updated
h3. Actual Results
The error "Cannot read property 'errorMessage' or undefined" is displayed
The below exception is thrown in the  application log file:
{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: ""
	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:65)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:592)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:615)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl.testEmailConfiguration(EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl.java:511)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page and update the default email account again
fields.summary: Changing the default email account on a newly enabled email request prompts an error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Search for "Request type" field does not work on Basic mode
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for *Request type* field on basic search mode

h3. Expected Results
Be able to select the *Request type* from the dropdown arrow
h3. Actual Results
You will get a message that this field will only work on Advance search mode

h3. Workaround

Search for this field on JQL Advance mode
fields.summary: Search for "Request type" field does not work on Basic mode
